place.name: BURSTALL
place.gazetteerText: BURSTALL, a parish in Samford district, Suffolk; on an affluent of the river Orwell, 2¾ miles WSW of Bramford r. station, and 4¾ W of Ipswich. Post Town, Bramford, under Ipswich. Acres, 766. Real property, £1,414. Pop., 222. Houses, 49. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Bramford, in the diocese of Norwich. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
